alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 3:39PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Tuscaloosa County through 415 PM CDT... At 339 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Samantha to near Tuscaloosa Regional Airport. Movement was northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Tuscaloosa, Northport, Coker, Lake Lurleen State Park, Binion Creek Landing, Tuscaloosa Amphitheater, Bryant Denny Stadium, Tuscaloosa Regional Airport, Lake Tuscaloosa, Flatwoods, Sexton Bend, University Of Alabama Quad, Palmore Park, Tierce Pattton Bridge, Stillman College, Highway 69 Bridge, Oliver Lock And Dam and Lake Nicol. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
